skills.name: Multiply a decimal by an integer
Multiply two decimals together with the same number of decimal places
Multiply two decimals together with a different number of decimal places

explanations.A: I think you have a place value error. Roughly how big should the answer be?
explanations.B: Nearly, I think you may have made a slip with a number. Maybe when halving?
explanations.C: 940 = 9.4 x 100. We are trying to find 9.4 x 50.
explanations.D: There are many ways to work this out, e.g. 9.4 x (100/2) = 940/2 = 470

explanations.A: Nearly, I think you may have made a slip with a number. Maybe when multiplying by 4?
explanations.B: I think you have a place value error. Roughly how big should the answer be?
explanations.C: There are many ways to work this out, e.g. 2.1 x (100 x 4) = 210 x 4 = 840
explanations.D: 210 = 2.1 x 100. We are trying to find 2.1 x 400.

explanations.A: Not quite, try and work out both sets of answers to check :)
explanations.B: Not quite, try and work out both sets of answers to check :)
explanations.C: Both of them involve 3 and 7, however in Tom's, one of the numbers is divided by 10, so both of Tom's are equivalent to 3 x 7 ÷ 10. On Katie's, we have one number divided by 100 and one divided by 10, which is the same as 1000 overall. So both of Katie's are equivalent to 3 x 7 ÷ 1000.
explanations.D: Not quite, try and work out both sets of answers to check :)

explanations.A: Not quite, try and work out both sets of answers to check :)
explanations.B: Jo is incorrect: both calculations involve 4 × 8 = 32, but the left is divided by 10 overall, and the right side is divided by 10 and 100 so 1000 overall. Paul is correct: the left is divided by 10 and 10 so 100 overall, and the right side is divided by 1000 and multiplied by 10, so the equivalent of dividing by 100 overall (the same as the left).
explanations.C: Not quite, try and work out both sets of answers to check :)
explanations.D: Not quite, try and work out both sets of answers to check :)

explanations.A: Not quite, remember that 0.4² means 0.4 squared
explanations.B: Not quite, remember that 0.4² means 0.4 squared
explanations.C: Not quite, think carefully about the number of decimal places your answer will have.
explanations.D: 0.4² is the same as 0.4 × 0.4. We know 4 × 4 = 16, and then, because 4 divided by 10 is 0.4, we must divide our answer by 10 twice, which is the same as dividing by 100, where all our digits move 2 place value columns to the right.

explanations.A: Not quite, remember that 0.3² means 0.3 squared
explanations.B: 0.3² is the same as 0.3 × 0.3. We know 3 × 3 = 9, and then, because 3 divided by 10 is 0.3, we must divide our answer by 10 twice, which is the same as dividing by 100, where all our digits move 2 place value columns to the right.
explanations.C: Not quite, think carefully about the number of decimal places your answer will have.
explanations.D: Not quite, remember that 0.3² means 0.3 squared

explanations.A: Not quite, think carefully about the number of decimal places your answer will have.
explanations.B: 0.02³ is the same as 0.02 x 0.02 x 0.02. We know 2 x 2 x 2 = 8, and then, because 2 divided by 100 is 0.02, we must divide our answer by 100 three times, which is the same as dividing by 1,000,000, (moving each digit 6 place value columns to the right).
explanations.C: Not quite, think carefully about the number of decimal places your answer will have.

explanations.A: Not quite, think carefully about the number of decimal places your answer will have.
explanations.B: 0.01³ is the same as 0.01 x 0.01 x 0.01. We know 1 x 1 x 1 = 1, and then, because 1 divided by 100 is 0.01, we must divide our answer by 100 three times, which is the same as dividing by 1,000,000, (moving each digit 6 place value columns to the right).
explanations.C: Not quite, remember that 0.01³ means 0.01 cubed.
explanations.D: Not quite, think carefully about the number of decimal places your answer will have.

explanations.A: Not quite, on the left side, Tom is doing 5 x 3 and 5 x 0.9. On the right side he is doing 3 x 5 and 3 x 0.9, therefore these answers are not equivalent.
explanations.B: Katie’s statement has just involved swapping the order of the numbers which is correct. Tom is incorrect because he has swapped the digits, which give different answers. You can see this easily by using estimation: 5 × 3.9 ≈ 5 × 4 = 20 whereas 3 × 5.9 ≈ 3 × 6 = 18.
explanations.C: Not quite, on the left side, Tom is doing 5 x 3 and 5 x 0.9. On the right side he is doing 3 x 5 and 3 x 0.9, therefore these answers are not equivalent.
explanations.D: Not quite, you could try checking both sides of the calculations and seeing if they are the same :)

explanations.A: Tom's statement has just involved swapping the order of the numbers which will lead to the same answer when multiplying. Katie is incorrect because she has swapped the digits, which give different answers. You can see this by splitting the left side into 2 x 5 and 0.1 x 5, and the right side into 5 x 2 and 0.1 x 2. Multiplying 0.1 by different numbers will give different answers.
explanations.B: Not quite, you could try checking both sides of the calculations and seeing if they are the same :)
explanations.C: Not quite, you could try checking both sides of the calculations and seeing if they are the same :)
explanations.D: Not quite, you could try checking both sides of the calculations and seeing if they are the same :)
